creditline: Gift of George W. Rickey in memory of Edith L. Rickey
description: comb with 3 teeth topped with 2 faces; one on top of the other; each face has closed eyes and large, protruding turned-up nose
marks: \"R85-110E\", in black, on back of PR tooth
text: Hairstyles have long reflected personal aesthetics in African and African-American cultures. But when adorned with false braids, beads, pins, or combs, they can indicate much more: ethnic origin, gender, profession, status, even what phase of life you’re in. These two combs and a hairpin—from West, Central, and East Africa, respectively —show how African artists turn even mundane objects into accomplished carvings.
title: Comb
